articles.headline: Sony Streams ‘The Interview’ on YouTube, Google Play and Xbox
articles.snippet: In getting behind “The Interview,” Google and Microsoft joined what had become more a campaign to defend free speech against foreign intimidation than a business initiative.
articles.abstract: In getting behind “The Interview,” Google and Microsoft joined what had become more a campaign to defend free speech against foreign intimidation than a business initiative.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — With the help of the technology giants Google and Microsoft, Sony Pictures began distributing “The Interview” online Wednesday after a terror threat led the major theater chains to cancel the film’s release.
articles.byline: By Michael Cieply and Brooks Barnes

articles.headline: Going Home From the South, a New Holiday Exodus
articles.snippet: A surge of native Californians and Northeasterners who travel home from the South highlights its new role as a place to pursue the American dream.
articles.abstract: A surge of native Californians and Northeasterners who travel home from the South highlights its new role as a place to pursue the American dream.
articles.lead_paragraph: The adopted Southerners have landed this week in San Francisco and Los Angeles, in New York, Chicago and Denver. It is the new pattern in holiday travel: Thousands of people raised in California, the Midwest or the Northeast will return, albeit temporarily, from their homes in Atlanta, Memphis or Raleigh.
articles.byline: By Alan Blinder, Robert Gebeloff and David Leonhardt

articles.headline: Retina 5K iMac: Powerful Proof of the PC Renaissance
articles.snippet: Defying predictions of their demise, personal computers are making a comeback, enticing a niche audience of professional users with power and beauty, and an Apple machine stands out.
articles.abstract: Defying predictions of their demise, personal computers are making a comeback, enticing a niche audience of professional users with power and beauty, and an Apple machine stands out.
articles.lead_paragraph: About a year before he died, Steve Jobs  was asked at a conference to predict the future of the market for personal computers. Back in the late 1970s, as the chief executive and a co-founder of Apple, Mr. Jobs had presided over the birth of the PC industry, but then, after blockbuster sales of the iPhone and the iPad, he had taken to describing the tech business as entering the “post-PC” era. Did he really believe that desktop and laptop computers were going extinct?

articles.headline: For Recent Black College Graduates, a Tougher Road to Employment
articles.snippet: Historically, the periods during and immediately after economic downturns have been harder on blacks. But the trend this time has been more extreme.
articles.abstract: Historically, the periods during and immediately after economic downturns have been harder on blacks. But the trend this time has been more extreme.
articles.lead_paragraph: William Zonicle did what all the job experts advise. He majored in a growing field like health care. He studied hard and took time to develop relationships with his professors. Most important, he obtained a great internship in the human resources department at Florida Hospital in Tampa the summer before his senior year.

articles.headline: Oil’s Swift Fall Raises Fortunes of U.S. Abroad
articles.snippet: A plunge in oil prices has sent tremors through the global political and economic order, helping the United States but pushing several big oil-exporting nations to the brink of financial crisis.
articles.abstract: A plunge in oil prices has sent tremors through the global political and economic order, helping the United States but pushing several big oil-exporting nations to the brink of financial crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — A plunge in oil prices has sent tremors through the global political and economic order, setting off an abrupt shift in fortunes that has bolstered the interests of the United States and pushed several big oil-exporting nations — particularly those hostile to the West, like Russia, Iran and Venezuela — to the brink of financial crisis.

articles.headline: Race to Deliver Nicotine’s Punch, With Less Risk
articles.snippet: Big tobacco companies are deploying their financial resources and knowledge in a bid to dominate a potentially huge market for cigarette alternatives.
articles.abstract: Big tobacco companies are deploying their financial resources and knowledge in a bid to dominate a potentially huge market for cigarette alternatives.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEUCHATEL, Switzerland — Deep inside a modernist research center on the edge of a mountain lake here, automated smoking machines sample the future of nicotine.

articles.headline: At Home and at Work, Black Police Officers Are on Defensive
articles.snippet: Life for black officers, many say, has long been a delicate balancing act between fellow blacks and their police station houses.
articles.abstract: Life for black officers, many say, has long been a delicate balancing act between fellow blacks and their police station houses.
articles.lead_paragraph: KANSAS CITY, Mo. — Dennis Shireff, a nearly 30-year police veteran, has never been shy about speaking out against what he saw as brutality and racism among his peers. While serving with the St. Louis police, he was even suspended for saying that the department recruited too many “Billy Bob, tobacco-chewing white police officers.”
articles.byline: By John Eligon and J. David Goodman

articles.headline: In Naples, Gift of Coffee to Strangers Never Seen
articles.snippet: The Neapolitan tradition of “suspended coffee” — paying for two, drinking one and leaving the receipt for the other for a stranger — has spread around the world.
articles.abstract: The Neapolitan tradition of “suspended coffee” — paying for two, drinking one and leaving the receipt for the other for a stranger — has spread around the world.
articles.lead_paragraph: NAPLES, Italy — One azure morning in December, Laura Cozzolino arrived at her corner cafe in central Naples and ordered her usual: a dense espresso, which arrived steaming hot on the dark marble counter.

articles.headline: From the New ‘Annie’ Movie, Lessons on Money and Inequality
articles.snippet: The updated movie musical can inspire a conversation with children about social class, wealth, possessions and what is truly valuable.
articles.abstract: The updated movie musical can inspire a conversation with children about social class, wealth, possessions and what is truly valuable.
articles.lead_paragraph: There will come a point in the next 10 days, after the cabin fever has set in, when the small people you parent, grandparent or otherwise dote on demand to see “Annie.”
